alert.note: Alert for Bedford; Franklin; Henry; Pittsylvania; Roanoke (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 05 at 1:04AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Periods of heavy rain will impact portions of Rockingham, eastern Roanoke, western Pittsylvania, Henry, southwestern Bedford and Franklin Counties, the City of Roanoke and the City of Martinsville through 200 AM EDT... At 100 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking showers and thunderstorms with heavy rain moving north along the Highway 220 corridor between Roanoke, Virginia and the North Carolina...Virginia border, just south of Martinsville. Movement was to the north. HAZARD...Heavy Rain with potential for excessive rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Flooding of poor drainage and low-lying areas. Ponding of water on roadways and highways. Some low water crossings may become flooded. Locations impacted include... Roanoke... Eden... Reidsville... Martinsville... Vinton... Rocky Mount... and Wentworth. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
